data.name: 0001 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well who cares about that. More importantly, I've figured out something incredible!

data.name: 0002 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You're way too loud. Keep it down.

data.name: 0003 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I can't just be quiet! I've uncovered the truth of this mystery!

data.name: 0004 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The key to the truth… is this!

data.name: 0005 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Full of confidence, Haruhi pointed to the class 1-6 plate.

data.name: 0006 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What about that scrap of wood is the key exactly?

data.name: 0007 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Despite knowing, I did my best to feign ignorance. It's all part of the act.

data.name: 0008 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well, at your level it would certainly be impossible to figure it out.

data.name: 0009 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: An annoying remark, but I'm not about to put everything we've done to waste.

data.name: 0010 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'll just respectfully listen to the deductions of renowned ultra detective Haruhi Suzumiya.

data.name: 0011 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You listening? The answer is elementary, that it was all a trick.

data.name: 0012 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The key lies with the structure of this building we call school.

data.name: 0013 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It goes without saying, but the classrooms are all the same shape, aren't they?

data.name: 0014 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I guess.

data.name: 0015 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If we were to be specific, parts of them might be slightly different…

data.name: 0016 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: But it's safe to say their structure is nearly identical.

data.name: 0017 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: For example… Hmm, what about your classroom Mikuru? It's the same as the first year, right?

data.name: 0018 (384.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm, yes. I think it's the same.

data.name: 0019 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: And Yuki's classroom?

data.name: 0020 (384.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The structure is similar. The furnishings are also approximately equal.

data.name: 0021 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: In other words—no matter what year or classroom, there's no big difference.

data.name: 0022 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I get that the structure is the same, but just what are you saying that means?

data.name: 0023 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Don't ruin my explanation! I'm still just laying the groundwork!

data.name: 0024 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Sure sure. That was my bad.

data.name: 0025 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Ultimately, the only way you can tell which class corresponds to which classroom, is this.

data.name: 0026 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If you flip that on its head, just by exchanging the plates…

data.name: 0027 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …even class 6 can become class 10!

data.name: 0028 (384.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I see… So that's what was going on?

data.name: 0029 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Koizumi nodded with admiration so theatrically —you couldn't even tell he was acting.

data.name: 0030 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You already get it, Koizumi?

data.name: 0031 (384.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: This is purely my personal conjecture, but…

data.name: 0032 (384.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I wonder if perhaps the plates were swapped?

data.name: 0033 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Ding ding ding! You're absolutely right! That's why you're the deputy brigade chief, Koizumi!

data.name: 0034 (384.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I'm honored to receive your praise.

data.name: 0035 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: You've got some nerve considering you're the guy that did it.

data.name: 0036 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Though, I should prompt her with a question so she clarifies her reasoning a bit more.

data.name: 0037 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It seems like Haruhi hasn't figured out the trick to how this works yet…

data.name: 0038 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Let's assume you're right about the plates being exchanged—

data.name: 0039 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you mean assume? That's—

data.name: 0040 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Let me finish.

data.name: 0041 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Why do you think that classroom is class 10? There's no plate with 10 on it.

data.name: 0042 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's a pretty good question coming from you, Kyon.

data.name: 0043 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'll give it to you straight.

data.name: 0044 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Looks like I don't even need to ask.

data.name: 0045 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What would you think if class 9's plate was in place of class 8's?

data.name: 0046 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I guess I'd think it was class 9.

data.name: 0047 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: And beyond that, if there was no plate where class 9 should be?

data.name: 0048 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You'd think it's class 10, right?

data.name: 0049 (384.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well… I guess so.

data.name: 0050 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Exactly! The plates were offset by one! I've discovered the truth!

data.name: 0051 (384.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm… But, for what reason would someone do such a thing?

data.name: 0052 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nice backup, Asahina.

data.name: 0053 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's got to be someone's prank. Not many people come to school over summer vacation…

data.name: 0054 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Maybe they were trying to confuse someone who comes here for club activities.

data.name: 0057 (384.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Then one of the members of the Computer Society got fantastically fooled.

data.name: 0058 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What a complete idiot.

data.name: 0059 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Thanks to that, I believed there was a man-eating classroom.

data.name: 0060 (384.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: And thanks to that, I worked to the bone to make you change your mind.

data.name: 0062 (384.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: All I can say is it turned out to be a massively lame conclusion.

data.name: 0063 (384.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: About Haruhi
